ko.explanation: 가장 많이 쓰이는 동사. 어떤 행동을 함. 다른 명사와 결합하여 동사를 만든다.

examples.advanced: 매일 아침 운동을 하는 것이 건강에 좋아요.
examples.master: 성공하려면 꾸준히 노력해야 한다.

en.explanation: The most commonly used verb. To do an action. Combines with nouns to form verbs.

examples.advanced: Exercising every morning is good for your health.
examples.master: To succeed, you must make continuous effort.

examples.advanced: 이번 주말에 부산에 가려고 해요.
examples.master: 시간이 빨리 가는 것 같아요. 벌써 12월이에요.

en.explanation: To move from one place to another.

examples.intermediate: I go to work by bus.
examples.advanced: I'm planning to go to Busan this weekend.
examples.master: Time seems to go by fast. It's already December.

examples.advanced: 저녁에 집에 일찍 와 주세요.
examples.master: 드디어 봄이 왔어요. 꽃이 피기 시작했어요.

en.explanation: To move from another place to here.

examples.advanced: Please come home early in the evening.
examples.master: Spring has finally come. Flowers are starting to bloom.

examples.advanced: 건강을 위해 채소를 많이 먹으려고 노력해요.
examples.master: 맛있는 음식을 먹는 것이 인생의 작은 행복 중 하나예요.

en.explanation: To chew and swallow food with the mouth.

examples.advanced: I try to eat a lot of vegetables for my health.
examples.master: Eating delicious food is one of life's small pleasures.

examples.advanced: 하루에 물을 2리터 이상 마시는 것이 좋아요.
examples.master: 친구와 함께 커피를 마시면서 이야기하는 시간이 좋아요.

en.explanation: To swallow liquid through the mouth.

examples.advanced: It's good to drink more than 2 liters of water a day.
examples.master: I like spending time drinking coffee and talking with friends.

ko.explanation: 눈으로 대상을 인식하다. 영화, TV 등을 시청하다.

examples.advanced: 책을 많이 보면 지식이 늘어요.
examples.master: 문제를 다른 관점에서 보면 해결책이 보일 거예요.

en.word: to see / to watch / to look
en.explanation: To perceive with the eyes. To watch movies, TV, etc.

examples.advanced: If you read many books, your knowledge will increase.
examples.master: If you look at the problem from a different perspective, you'll find a solution.

examples.advanced: 다른 사람의 이야기를 잘 들으면 배울 것이 많아요.
examples.master: 그 소식을 들었을 때 정말 놀랐어요.

en.explanation: To perceive sound with the ears. To take classes.

examples.advanced: If you listen well to others' stories, there's a lot to learn.
examples.master: I was really surprised when I heard that news.

examples.advanced: 솔직하게 말하면 기분이 좋아질 거예요.
examples.master: 말보다 행동이 더 중요하다는 것을 깨달았어요.

en.word: to speak / to say / to talk
en.explanation: To express meaning by making sounds with the mouth.

examples.advanced: If you speak honestly, you'll feel better.
examples.master: I realized that actions are more important than words.

examples.advanced: 매일 30분씩 책을 읽으면 지식이 쌓여요.
examples.master: 그의 표정을 읽기가 어려워서 무슨 생각인지 모르겠어요.

en.explanation: To look at written text and understand its meaning.

examples.advanced: If you read for 30 minutes every day, knowledge accumulates.
examples.master: It's hard to read his expression, so I don't know what he's thinking.

examples.advanced: 일기를 매일 쓰면 한국어 실력이 늘어요.
examples.master: 작가가 되려면 꾸준히 글을 써야 해요.

en.explanation: To put down letters. Or to use something.

examples.intermediate: Please write your name with a pencil.
examples.advanced: If you write a diary every day, your Korean skills improve.
examples.master: To become a writer, you must write consistently.

examples.advanced: 알면 알수록 더 많이 배우고 싶어져요.
examples.master: 세상을 알면 알수록 겸손해지는 것 같아요.

en.explanation: To recognize information or facts. To understand.

examples.advanced: The more I know, the more I want to learn.
examples.master: The more I know about the world, the more humble I become.

examples.advanced: 모르는 것이 있으면 부끄러워하지 말고 물어보세요.
examples.master: 모른다고 인정하는 것이 배움의 시작이에요.

en.explanation: To not know information or facts.

examples.intermediate: I didn't know the way, so I asked.
examples.advanced: If there's something you don't know, don't be embarrassed to ask.
examples.master: Admitting you don't know is the beginning of learning.

examples.advanced: 여기에 좋은 레스토랑이 있어요.
examples.master: 인생에는 항상 희망이 있어요.

en.word: to exist / to have / to be (at)
en.explanation: To exist. To be located at a place. To possess.

examples.advanced: There's a good restaurant here.
examples.master: There is always hope in life.

examples.advanced: 불가능한 일은 없어요. 노력하면 할 수 있어요.
examples.master: 문제없어요. 제가 도와드릴게요.

en.word: to not exist / to not have
en.explanation: To not exist. To not possess.

examples.intermediate: I can't go because I don't have time.
examples.advanced: Nothing is impossible. If you try, you can do it.
examples.master: No problem. I'll help you.

examples.advanced: 하루에 7시간 이상 자는 것이 건강에 좋아요.
examples.master: 걱정이 많아서 요즘 잠을 잘 못 자요.

en.explanation: To sleep. To rest with eyes closed.

examples.advanced: Sleeping more than 7 hours a day is good for health.
examples.master: I have many worries, so I can't sleep well these days.

ko.explanation: 잠에서 깨다. 또는 앉거나 누운 상태에서 서다.

examples.advanced: 아침에 일찍 일어나는 것이 힘들어요.
examples.master: 실패해도 다시 일어나는 것이 중요해요.

en.word: to wake up / to get up
en.explanation: To wake from sleep. Or to stand up from sitting or lying down.

examples.beginner: I wake up in the morning.
examples.intermediate: What time do you wake up?
examples.advanced: It's hard to wake up early in the morning.
examples.master: It's important to get back up even if you fail.

examples.advanced: 온라인에서 물건을 사면 편해요.
examples.master: 시간은 돈으로 살 수 없어요.

en.explanation: To give money and get goods.

examples.advanced: It's convenient to buy things online.
examples.master: Time cannot be bought with money.

examples.advanced: 중고품을 온라인에서 팔았어요.
examples.master: 좋은 제품을 만들면 잘 팔릴 거예요.

en.explanation: To give goods in exchange for money.

examples.advanced: I sold used items online.
examples.master: If you make a good product, it will sell well.

examples.advanced: 도움을 주면 기분이 좋아요.
examples.master: 주는 것이 받는 것보다 행복하다는 말이 있어요.

en.explanation: To pass things or items to another person.

examples.advanced: It feels good to give help.
examples.master: There's a saying that giving is happier than receiving.

examples.advanced: 좋은 평가를 받아서 기뻐요.
examples.master: 스트레스를 많이 받으면 건강에 안 좋아요.

en.explanation: To have what another person gives.

examples.advanced: I'm happy that I received good reviews.
examples.master: If you receive a lot of stress, it's bad for your health.

examples.advanced: 좋은 사람을 만나면 인생이 바뀔 수 있어요.
examples.master: 인연이 있으면 언젠가 다시 만날 거예요.

en.explanation: To see another person at the same place.

examples.intermediate: We met after a long time.
examples.advanced: If you meet good people, your life can change.
examples.master: If we're meant to be, we'll meet again someday.

ko.explanation: 어떤 일이 일어나거나 사람이 올 때까지 머무르다.

examples.advanced: 좋은 기회를 기다리는 것도 실력이에요.
examples.master: 기다리는 시간도 인생의 일부예요.

en.explanation: To stay until something happens or someone comes.

examples.advanced: Waiting for a good opportunity is also a skill.
examples.master: The time spent waiting is also part of life.

examples.advanced: 연습하면 잘할 수 있게 돼요.
examples.master: 노력하면 뭐든지 될 수 있어요.

en.explanation: To change into a state or situation. To be possible.

examples.beginner: I want to become a doctor.
examples.advanced: If you practice, you can become good at it.
examples.master: If you try, you can become anything.

examples.advanced: 행복하게 사는 것이 가장 중요해요.
examples.master: 하루하루를 최선을 다해 살고 싶어요.

en.explanation: To be alive. To reside in a place.

examples.advanced: Living happily is the most important thing.
examples.master: I want to live each day to the fullest.

examples.advanced: 열심히 일하면 성공할 수 있어요.
examples.master: 일과 삶의 균형을 맞추는 것이 중요해요.

en.explanation: To perform a job or duties.

examples.advanced: If you work hard, you can succeed.
examples.master: It's important to balance work and life.

examples.advanced: 실수에서 많이 배울 수 있어요.
examples.master: 평생 배우는 자세가 중요해요.

en.explanation: To acquire new knowledge or skills.

examples.advanced: You can learn a lot from mistakes.
examples.master: It's important to have a lifelong learning attitude.

examples.advanced: 학생들을 가르치는 것이 보람 있어요.
examples.master: 가르치면서 배우는 것도 많아요.

en.explanation: To transfer knowledge or skills to another person.

examples.advanced: Teaching students is rewarding.
examples.master: You learn a lot while teaching.

examples.advanced: 긍정적으로 생각하면 결과도 좋아요.
examples.master: 생각이 바뀌면 행동도 바뀌어요.

en.explanation: To judge or recall with the mind.

examples.advanced: If you think positively, the results will be good too.
examples.master: When your thinking changes, your actions change too.

examples.advanced: 음악을 들으면 감동을 느껴요.
examples.master: 자연 속에서 평화를 느낄 수 있어요.

en.explanation: To perceive a sensation or emotion.

examples.advanced: When I listen to music, I feel moved.
examples.master: You can feel peace in nature.

examples.advanced: 좋아하는 일을 하면 행복해요.
examples.master: 좋아하는 것을 직업으로 만드는 것이 꿈이에요.

en.explanation: To have affection because something pleases you.

examples.advanced: If you do what you like, you're happy.
examples.master: My dream is to make what I like into a career.

examples.advanced: 싫어하는 것도 경험해 보면 좋아질 수 있어요.
examples.master: 편견 없이 사람을 만나면 싫어하던 것도 좋아질 수 있어요.

en.explanation: To have aversion because something doesn't please you.

examples.advanced: If you try things you dislike, you might come to like them.
examples.master: If you meet people without prejudice, you might come to like what you disliked.

examples.advanced: 성공하려면 노력이 필요해요.
examples.master: 필요한 것과 원하는 것을 구분하는 것이 중요해요.

en.explanation: To have to exist. To be required.

examples.advanced: Effort is necessary to succeed.
examples.master: It's important to distinguish between what you need and what you want.

examples.advanced: 진심으로 원하면 이루어질 거예요.
examples.master: 원하는 것을 얻기 위해서는 그만큼 노력해야 해요.

en.explanation: To wish for and try to obtain.

examples.advanced: If you sincerely want it, it will come true.
examples.master: To get what you want, you need to put in that much effort.

examples.advanced: 더운 날에는 시원한 음료가 최고예요.
examples.master: 지구 온난화 때문에 점점 더 더워지고 있어요.

en.explanation: To be uncomfortable because of high temperature.

examples.advanced: Cold drinks are the best on hot days.
examples.master: It's getting hotter because of global warming.

examples.advanced: 추울 때는 따뜻한 국물 요리가 좋아요.
examples.master: 한국의 겨울은 춥지만 눈이 와서 예뻐요.

en.explanation: To shiver because of low temperature.

examples.advanced: Warm soup dishes are good when it's cold.
examples.master: Korean winters are cold, but beautiful when it snows.

examples.advanced: 지구가 태양 주위를 돌아요.
examples.master: 세상이 어떻게 돌아가는지 이해하기 어려워요.

en.word: to turn / to spin / to go around
en.explanation: To move in a circle. To change direction.

examples.advanced: The Earth goes around the sun.
examples.master: It's hard to understand how the world works.

examples.advanced: 여행에서 돌아오니까 일상이 그리웠어요.
examples.master: 잃어버린 것은 돌아오지 않으니 소중히 여기세요.

en.explanation: To come back to where one was before.

examples.advanced: When I came back from the trip, I missed daily life.
examples.master: What is lost won't come back, so cherish it.

examples.advanced: 비가 내리고 있어서 우산이 필요해요.
examples.master: 산에서 내려올 때 무릎이 아팠어요.

en.word: to go down / to get off / to fall (rain/snow)
en.explanation: To move from above to below. To get out of a vehicle.

examples.intermediate: I'll get off at the next stop.
examples.advanced: It's raining, so I need an umbrella.
examples.master: My knees hurt when I came down from the mountain.

ko.explanation: 아래에서 위로 이동하다. 가격이나 수준이 높아지다.

examples.advanced: 물가가 많이 올랐어요.
examples.master: 노력하면 언젠가 정상에 오를 수 있어요.

en.word: to climb / to go up / to rise
en.explanation: To move from below to above. For prices or levels to increase.

examples.advanced: Prices have risen a lot.
examples.master: If you try, you can reach the top someday.

examples.advanced: 자전거를 타면 건강에 좋아요.
examples.master: 새로운 것에 도전하면 열정이 타오를 거예요.

en.word: to ride / to take (transportation) / to burn
en.explanation: To get on a means of transportation. To burn in fire.

examples.advanced: Riding a bicycle is good for your health.
examples.master: If you challenge new things, your passion will burn.

examples.advanced: 걷기 운동이 건강에 좋아요.
examples.master: 인생은 마라톤처럼 천천히 걸어가는 거예요.

en.explanation: To move by moving the feet.

examples.advanced: Walking exercise is good for health.
examples.master: Life is like a marathon—you walk slowly.

examples.advanced: 꿈을 향해 달려가고 있어요.
examples.master: 멈추지 않고 달리면 언젠가 목표에 도달해요.

en.explanation: To move quickly by running.

examples.advanced: I'm running toward my dream.
examples.master: If you keep running without stopping, you'll reach your goal someday.

ko.explanation: 의자나 바닥에 엉덩이를 대고 자세를 취하다.

examples.advanced: 오래 앉아 있으면 건강에 안 좋아요.
examples.master: 바쁜 하루 끝에 편하게 앉을 때 가장 행복해요.

en.explanation: To take a position with buttocks on a chair or floor.

examples.advanced: Sitting for a long time is bad for health.
examples.master: I'm happiest when I sit comfortably after a busy day.

ko.explanation: 두 발로 몸을 지탱하고 있다. 멈추다.

examples.advanced: 오래 서 있으면 다리가 아파요.
examples.master: 세상 앞에 당당히 서고 싶어요.

en.explanation: To support the body on two feet. To stop.

examples.advanced: If you stand for a long time, your legs hurt.
examples.master: I want to stand proudly before the world.

examples.advanced: 눕자마자 바로 잠들었어요.
examples.master: 하늘을 보며 잔디밭에 누워 있으니 마음이 편해져요.

en.explanation: To be in a horizontal position.

examples.intermediate: I was tired, so I lay down for a bit.
examples.advanced: I fell asleep as soon as I lay down.
examples.master: Lying on the grass looking at the sky puts my mind at ease.

ko.explanation: 닫혀 있는 것을 움직여 안이 보이게 하다.

examples.advanced: 마음을 열면 친구를 사귈 수 있어요.
examples.master: 새로운 기회의 문이 열릴 거예요.

en.explanation: To move something closed so the inside is visible.

examples.advanced: If you open your heart, you can make friends.
examples.master: A door to new opportunities will open.

ko.explanation: 열려 있는 것을 움직여 안이 안 보이게 하다.

examples.advanced: 가게가 10시에 닫아요.
examples.master: 한 문이 닫히면 다른 문이 열린다고 해요.

en.explanation: To move something open so the inside is not visible.

examples.advanced: The store closes at 10.
examples.master: They say when one door closes, another opens.

examples.advanced: 인터넷에서 정보를 찾았어요.
examples.master: 진정한 행복을 찾는 것이 인생의 목표예요.

en.explanation: To discover something lost or needed.

examples.advanced: I found information on the internet.
examples.master: Finding true happiness is the goal of life.

examples.advanced: 바빠서 전화를 못 받았어요.
examples.master: 요즘은 전화보다 메시지를 더 많이 보내요.

en.explanation: To talk to another person using a phone.

examples.advanced: I was busy, so I couldn't answer the phone.
examples.master: These days, I send messages more than I call.

examples.advanced: 이메일을 보내는 것을 깜빡했어요.
examples.master: 시간을 의미 있게 보내는 것이 중요해요.

en.explanation: To deliver things or messages to another place.

examples.advanced: I forgot to send the email.
examples.master: It's important to spend time meaningfully.
